definition: (to live together until the) white hairs of old age (idiom); to live to a ripe old age in conjugal bliss/until death do us part

sentences.english: It is more fun to go with someone than to go alone.
sentences.chinese: 偕伴同去比自己独自去好玩。

sentences.english: People starved of sleep may find it difficult to focus their minds on what they are doing .
sentences.chinese: 缺乏睡眠的人会感到很难集核心硕嗌偕活。

sentences.english: The "Masho Style of Haiku" is a milestone in the history of Japanese poetry.
sentences.chinese: 他开创的“蕉风俳偕”是日本诗歌史上的里程碑。

sentences.english: The heliacal rising or setting of a star indicates to within a few days the date in the annual day-cycle.
sentences.chinese: 星辰偕日升降，说明了其在几天内年日循环的日期。

sentences.english: They swear to go through the ups and downs of life together.
sentences.chinese: 他们发誓要相偕走过人生的风风雨雨。

sentences.english: H.E. Mr. Yang Youming, Chinese Ambassador to Trinidad and Tobago, attended the event with his wife and presented one of the awards to Karene Asche for her "Audacity of Hope".
sentences.chinese: 中国驻特多大使杨优明偕夫人出席并为优胜者颁奖。

definition: accompanied by one's dependents/encumbered by wife and children
to carry/to take along/to bring along/to hold (hands)/also pr. [xi1]
to attend (an official function)/to be present/to administer/to approach (esp. as administrator)
variant of 蒞|莅[li4], to attend
your visit (honorific)/you honor me with your visit
to visit/to call on/to seek/to inquire/to investigate
to visit/to pay one's respects to (a revered figure etc)/to pay homage (at a tomb etc)
to pay a formal visit/to call to pay respects/to pay homage (at a monument, mausoleum etc)
elderly man/father/father-in-law/neck feathers of a bird (old)
to go/to visit (e.g. another country)/to attend (a banquet etc)
